thread.title: Morning Sports Update: Jets player doesn’t want to pump up Tom Brady - Patriots
thread.title_full: Morning Sports Update: Jets player doesn’t want to pump up Tom Brady - Patriots

author: Gary Dzen
title: Morning Sports Update: Jets player doesn’t want to pump up Tom Brady - Patriots
text:
Jets safety Marcus Gilchris has an interesting comparison for Tom Brady, the Celtics win again, and all the relevant sports news to start your Friday.
Jets safety on Brady: ‘You prepare the same way you prepare for Kirk Cousins’: “You don’t change. It’s like turning the light switch on and off because it’s a different person. Kirk Cousins could have easily come out there (last week) and we could’ve not played sound football and not been where we were supposed to be and he could’ve looked the same way (like Brady). We can’t allow one game to be bigger than the other. Do we realize the type of player we’re playing against? Yes, we do. But you don’t change. We’ve got to be 1-0 this week, regardless of who it is – Brady – regardless of who we’re playing.” ( USA Today )
Marcus Smart looks poised to break out: “The second-year guard scored seven points and tied his regular season career-high with nine assists in a team-high 27 minutes, all while matching up against the Knicks’ regulars. The 21-year-old was in complete command of Boston’s offense both in the halfcourt and on the break, repeatedly setting up his teammates for easy looks.” ( Boston.com )
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Playing both sides: These guys have worn Patriots and Jets colors: “The bitter rivals have the same division, coastline, and interstate (I-95). And through the years, they’ve had many of the same players. Particularly in the early 2000’s, the Patriots and Jets teams swapped players often.” ( Boston.com )
Jerry Remy returning to NESN’s Red Sox broadcast team: “The network announced Thursday night that Remy, who has been part of team’s television broadcasts since 1988, has renewed his contract and will remain the primary color analyst in 2016, working at least 100 games.” ( Boston.com )
Julian Edelman does Tom Brady, Bill Belichick impressions in E:60 trailer: “New England Patriots fans are going to want to set their DVRs. ESPN is airing an E:60 featuring Patriots wide receiver Julian Edelman on Tuesday Oct. 27 at 8 p.m. Edelman breaks out quality impressions of Patriots quarterback Tom Brady and head coach Bill Belichick in the trailer for the feature.” ( NESN.com )
